articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Felicitates Iranian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Felicitates Iranian President
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on March 15 sent a message of greeting to Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad on the occasion of the New Year of Iranian calendar.
					Kim in the message sincerely wished the president and people of Iran greater achievements in the work for defending the sovereignty and dignity of the country, and friendly Iran development and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Namibian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Namibian President
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Hifikepunye Pohamba, president of Namibia, on the 22nd anniversary of its independence.
					In the message Kim wished the president and people of Namibia greater achievements in their work for the country's stability and sustained development and expressed belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to grow stronger.

articles.title: Greetings to First Vice-President of Iran
articles.content:
Greetings to First Vice-President of Iran
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim sent a message of greeting to Mohammad-Reza Rahimi, first vice-president of Iran, on March 15 on the occasion of the New Year of Iranian calender.
					The message wished the Iranian government greater achievements in its work for peace, development and prosperity in the new year.
					
					Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a similar message to his Iranian counterpart Ali Akbar Salehi on the same day.

articles.title: Reception Given at DPRK Embassy in Moscow
articles.content:
Reception Given at DPRK Embassy in Moscow
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The DPRK embassy in Moscow gave a reception on March 15 to mark the 63rd anniversary of conclusion of the agreement on economic and cultural cooperation between the DPRK and the Russian Federation.
					Present there on invitation were officials of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Ministry of Regional Development, the Ministry of Culture, the Ministry of Agriculture and the Ministry of Extraordinary Situation of Russia, the Gazprom, the "Russian Railways" Company and the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK and officials concerned.
					
					Present there were the DPRK ambassador to Russia and staff members of his embassy.
					
					The participants laid bouquets before the full-length painting of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					They went round photos displayed on the themes of "The great leader of the Korean people Comrade Kim Jong Il" and "Whole life dedicated to the people".
					
					Speeches were made at the reception.
					
					Meanwhile, a film show and a reception took place at the DPRK consulate-general in Nakhodka on March 16.

articles.title: KCNA Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
KCNA Delegation Back Home
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Korean Central News Agency headed by its First Vice-Director General Kim Chang Kwang returned home Tuesday. It took part in the opening ceremony of the joint photo exhibition held in the U.S. to commemorate the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					Football players of the DPRK also returned home after winning the title of the Under-19 International Women's Soccer "Spring of Kuban" on the same day.

articles.title: Pyongyang to Host 28th ASFAF
articles.content:
Pyongyang to Host 28th ASFAF
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The 28th April Spring Friendship Art Festival (ASFAF) will be held with splendor in Pyongyang to mark the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					It will bring together art groups, dance groups and acrobatic troupes composed of famous international and national concours winners and renowned artistes from various countries of the world, as well as the art groups of overseas compatriots and Korean artistes.
					
					Put on the stage will be colorful and peculiar programs including singing, instrumental music, dance and acrobatic numbers. 
					
					In the idea of independence, friendship and peace, the Festival will offer an important occasion in strengthening the friendly ties and promoting cultural exchanges and cooperation among the peoples and artistes around the world.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Revolutionary Career Characterized by Field Guidance
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Revolutionary Career Characterized by Field Guidance
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The Korean Central News Agency Monday issued a report on the brilliant life of leader Kim Jong Il characterized by his field guidance in the run-up to 100 days after his demise.
					The report said that Kim Jong Il visited some 14 290 units all his life to assist President Kim Il Sung with loyalty and wisely lead the struggle for the victory in the Songun revolutionary cause pioneered in the forest of Mt. Paektu.
					
					Till the last moments of his great life he covered more than 669 844 km for field guidance, the distance equal to 17 round-the earth trips, defending the country, the revolution and socialism despite unprecedented adversity and opening a new history of building a thriving nation.
					
					He organized a group for study tour of revolutionary battle sites, the first of its kind in the DPRK, in June 1956, exploring the way of historic tour of areas of Mt. Paektu.
					
					He provided field guidance to the Seoul Ryu Kyong Su 105 Guards Tank Division of the Korean People's Army on Aug. 25, 1960, making a historical declaration of the successful succession to the Songun revolutionary cause started by Kim Il Sung with arms.
					
					During the Songun revolutionary leadership he provided field guidance to more than 12 790 units and covered 629 992 km for such journeys.
					
					Kim Jong Il provided ceaseless revolutionary leadership to bring about a great heyday in all fields of the socialist construction including politics, economy and culture, holding high the banner of Songun.
					
					In the grimmest period for the country he conducted the grand march of Songun unprecedented in history, ushering in a new era of prosperity.
					
					Kim Jong Il, a great revolutionary and great man, used to take a short and uncomfortable sleep and a rice ball as his meal, leading the Arduous March. He covered 353 576 km for forced marches till the last moments of his life. These facts are recorded in the history of building a thriving nation.
					
					He unrolled a grand plan to glorify the year of 2012 which marks the centenary of the birth of Kim Il Sung as a proud and victorious year in the history of building a thriving nation. He visited Kangson on Dec. 24, 2008 and kindled a torch for a new surge.
					
					The last three years of his life was a review of his popular and heroic life as a legendary great man unprecedented in history as he made tours day and night as a standard bearer in the ranks of the onward movement for a great surge. 
					
					In those days he visited nearly 1 000 units. He conducted ceaseless forced marches despite snowstorm and sultriness day and night. 
					
					Kim Jong Il performed undying feats on behalf of the era, the revolution, the country and the nation with his outstanding ideas and theories, extraordinary leadership, iron-willed faith and superman-like energy. As he was totally dedicated to the revolution all his life, he was aboard a train till the last moments of his life.
					
					He made his whole life shine with self-sacrificing forced marches, enduring pent-up mental and physical stress and illness with his superman-like energy. Thanks to the devotion and indefatigable efforts of the peerlessly great man, an eternal foundation for a thriving socialist country has been laid on this land.
					
					All the servicepersons and people of the DPRK will consider the revolutionary history of forced marches made by Kim Jong Il as an eternal treasure of Songun Korea and dash ahead like the wind, keeping pace with the footsteps of the dear respected Kim Jong Un and thus commemorate the centenary of the birth of Kim Il Sung with victories and usher in new years of prosperity, concluded the report.

articles.title: Phophyong Ferry in DPRK
articles.content:
Phophyong Ferry in DPRK
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- On the shore of the River Amnok in northern part of Korea, there is a Phophyong ferry.
					In March Juche 12 (1923), President Kim Il Sung crossed the river through the ferry to make a 250-mile journey for learning to Mangyongdae, his birthplace, witnessing people leaving the homeland due to suppression by the Japanese imperialists.
					
					When he was 14 years old he crossed the River Amnok again, determined not to return home unless he won the independence of the country. At that time he walked a 250-mile journey to arrive at the river bank near the ferry and picked up a pebble to keep as a token of the homeland before crossing.
					
					In this regard he wrote in his reminiscences "With the Century":
					
					"My dear Korea, I am leaving you. I know I cannot live even for a moment away from you, but I am crossing the Amnok to win you back. Across this river is a foreign land, but I will not forget you, even in there. Wait for me, my Korea. Then I sang the Song of the River Amnok again."
					
					True to the resolution he made that day, he liberated Korea through a protracted anti-Japanese armed struggle and built a socialist country centered on the popular masses.
					
					The ferry is also associated with revolutionary activities of his family members.

articles.title: Haktanggol Revolutionary Site in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Haktanggol Revolutionary Site in Pyongyang
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The Haktanggol Revolutionary Site is situated in central Pyongyang.
					It is the historic place where Kim Hyong Jik, outstanding leader of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement and indomitable revolutionary fighter, formed the Korean National Association (KNA) on Mar. 23, Juche 6 (1917).
					
					He set forth the idea of "Jiwon" (aim high) and conducted energetic activities before the formation of the KNA. The Association greatly contributed to switching the anti-Japanese national liberation movement in Korea from the nationalist movement to the proletarian revolution and achieving the unity of the anti-Japanese independence movement.
					
					Later, he proposed measures for expanding the KNA at several meetings including the Haktanggol meeting in early February 1919. 
					
					At the site, there is a monument "May the Korean National Association Shine Forever" erected to hand down his undying exploits.

articles.title: Football Tournament Finished in DPRK
articles.content:
Football Tournament Finished in DPRK
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- A football tournament took place at Kim Il Sung Stadium and Sosan Football Stadium in Pyongyang from February 20 to March 18.
					13 men's and 10 women's teams competed in league matches.
					
					The Amnokgang men's team and the April 25 women's team placed first, with nine wins and three draws in 12 matches and eight wins and one draw in nine matches respectively.
					
					Meanwhile, the Rimyongsu men's team and Ponghwasan women's team finished second and Kigwancha men's team and Sobaeksu women's team third.

articles.title: 415th Triplets Born in DPRK
articles.content:
415th Triplets Born in DPRK
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The 415th triplets were born in the DPRK on March 19. They are two baby girls and one baby boy.
					Their mother Kim Sun Ok residing in neighborhood unit 23 of Jangchung 2-dong in Sonkyo District is a worker of the Pyongyang Shoe Wholesale Store and their father Kim Kyong Nam is a worker at the Pyongyang Soju Factory.
					
					Since Kim Sun Ok was admitted to the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital on Dec. 13 she received the best privileges and rest cure for nearly 100 days thanks to the benevolence of the party and the state and the care of medical workers.
					
					For her easy delivery operation and curing teams were made up of competent doctors, dozens of consultative meetings were held and curative measures were taken.
					
					Flowing into her body were honey tonics including the royal jelly honey and the barrenwort honey and various kinds of nutrients.
					
					The triplets in incubators are now in good condition.
					
					In July 1947 the first triplets were born in the DPRK. At that time President Kim Il Sung said that it was a very auspicious event, adding that the country should be responsible for the coming triplets and their mothers and take special care of them.
					
					Since the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital was built under the guidance of leader Kim Jong Il, it has established a system of hospitalizing for several months the women pregnant with triplets for easy deliveries and raising the babies until they reach 4 kg in weight.
					
					Whenever triplets were born, Kim Jong Il was the first to bless their happy future. He heaped them with all kinds of gifts including clothes, blankets, milk, honey, nutritious food and even wedding cloths.
					
					He even let silver knives and gold rings be given to them with the dates of their birth carved on them. Thanks to Kim Jong Il's largesse, triplets and quadruplets who were born after the liberation of Korea and their parents received those gifts.

articles.title: KCNA Denounces Japanese Politician's Rhetoric about "Abduction Issue"
articles.content:
KCNA Denounces Japanese Politician's Rhetoric about "Abduction Issue"
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Matsubara, minister in charge of "abduction issue" of Japan, said Japan can look into the humanitarian aid issue only when the "abduction issue" makes progress. He said this on March 13 as regards the international trend of approaching humanitarian aid issue apart from political issue.
					The Japanese government has reportedly embarked on readjusting its sanctions on the DPRK in the direction of extending them one more year. The sanctions originated from the "abduction issue".
					
					This again offers a glimpse into Japan's wicked nature as a political dwarf which has been brought to light more often than not.
					
					The Japanese authorities' oft-repeated talk about the "abduction issue", which had already seen a solution, is aimed to silence the international voices demanding Japan's redemption of its hideous crimes against humanity, and evade apology and reparation.
					
					As universally recognized, no statute of limitations is applicable to the crimes against humanity committed by the Japanese imperialists in the past century.
					
					They drafted more than 8.4 million young and middle-aged Koreans, forcing them into medieval slavery or hurling them as cannon fodder into battlefields for aggression. They killed over one million Koreans in cold blood.
					
					They also forced 200 000 Korean women to provide sex to the Japanese beasts during the wartime, violating their youth and chastity. They even massacred them to cover up their monstrous crimes.
					
					Still ringing out across the country are bitter voices of the victims cursing the Japanese imperialists.
					
					International voices demanding reparation for the Japanese imperialists' past crimes have become more assertive now.
					
					Solidarity actions to secure formal apology and reparation from Japan took place in more than 40 cities in U.S., Germany, Canada, Italy and many other countries and regions on December 14 last year.
					
					A monument was built in New Jersey to recall people to the Imperial Japanese Army's sexual slavery crimes.
					
					All facts show that Japan is still in the dock as regards the human rights issue.
					
					Japan, which has not yet shaken off the ill fame as an enemy state, is resorting to a sleight of hand to stave off a flurry of international protest and censure, under the veil of the "victims to abduction".
					
					Japan's crafty and sordid behavior will only add to the crimes it committed in the past.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries' Militarist Ambition for Overseas Expansion Assailed: Minju Joson
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries' Militarist Ambition for Overseas Expansion Assailed: Minju Joson
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The Japanese government has reportedly begun the examination for the revision of "law on cooperation in UN peace-keeping operations." The major objective of the revision is to moderate the standard of arms use of the "Self-Defense Forces" during "UN peace-keeping operations."
					The Japanese government said the revision is aimed to provide "protection" and "self-defense" to members of "Self-Defense Forces" and civilians during SDF's involvement in "UN peace-keeping operations" overseas.
					
					Commenting on this, Minju Joson Tuesday dismisses this as a cheap burlesque to deceive others and justify their sordid intention.
					
					Craftiness and shamelessness have been nature peculiar to Japan, the paper says, and goes on:
					
					The Japanese reactionaries obsessed by militarist ambition for overseas expansion have long worked hard to revise Article 9 of the Constitution which binds their hands and feet.
					
					In parallel with this, the Japanese reactionaries cooked up several laws including "law on cooperation in UN peace-keeping operations" in 1992 and "law on special measures against terrorism" in October 2001 by interpreting the Constitution to be useful to them. This resulted in rendering the Constitution defunct and paving the way for the SDFs' overseas advance.
					
					But not satisfied with this, the Japanese reactionaries seek to pave the way for the SDF troops operating overseas to carry out military activities for aggression unhindered.
					
					Herein lies the reason that they try to ease the standard of arms use for their military operations overseas.
					
					All facts prove that Japan has stepped up the preparations for aggression and war, far from working for peace.
					
					Japanese politicians should not forget the miserable end their predecessors met by leading the country to ruin, pursuant to a war line.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Denounces S. Korean Regime for Nuclear Racket against DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Denounces S. Korean Regime for Nuclear Racket against DPRK
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The south Korean regime's desperate efforts to escalate the nuclear racket against the DPRK is an artifice to justify its moves to ignite a nuclear war against the north and step them up under the pretext of "nuclear threat from the north".
					Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in a bylined article.
					
					The article goes on: 
					
					The south Korean group of traitors is getting frantic with its provocative nuclear racket against the north, trumpeting about the "nuclear issue of the north" and "message" in the run-up to the "nuclear security summit".
					
					It is the ferocious warmongers of south Korea who offered south Korea as a huge nuclear arsenal and a dangerous nuclear advance base of the U.S., seriously disturbing peace and security on the Korean Peninsula. This being a hard reality, they are now vociferating about "the nuclear issue of the north" and the like under the pretext of "nuclear security". This is nothing but a political cartoon ridiculous enough to make even a cow laugh.
					
					The adventurous scenario of these warmongers to provoke a nuclear war on the peninsula at any cost in collusion with outside forces finds a vivid expression in the fact that they kicked off dangerous joint military drills for a preemptive nuclear attack on the DPRK during the mourning period.
					
					What merits a more serious attention is that the Lee group is busy staging such dangerous saber-rattling against the north while gravely hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK. This goes to clearly prove what dangerous phase the U.S. and the south Korean warmongers' nuclear war hysteria has reached as it is a declaration of war against the north.
					
					Their ceaseless moves to start a war against the north have already gone beyond the danger line. The outbreak of a nuclear war on the peninsula is a matter of time. 
					
					If the Lee group continues rushing headlong into a nuclear war as servants of the U.S., it will only meet bitter destruction.

articles.title: "Kim Il Sung's Korea", Special Write-ups to Centenary of His Birth (5)
articles.content:
"Kim Il Sung's Korea", Special Write-ups to Centenary of His Birth (5)
Anti-Japanese Armed Struggle Based on Army-civilian Unity and Self-reliance
					
					Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The Korean People's Revolutionary Army (KPRA) led by President Kim Il Sung defeated the imperial Japanese army incomparably superior in numerical strength and military equipment. One of the secrets of its victory was the idea of army-civilian unity maintained in the struggle.
					
					In those days activists for the national liberation movement in Korea failed to have confidence in the strength of its people, insisting on the existing theory on the national liberation in colonial countries and seeking to win the independence of the country with the backing of big powers.
					
					However, Kim Il Sung was of the view that national sovereignty can be won and defended only by the nation's own efforts and, on the basis of this view he founded the KPRA relying on the popular masses with a strong sense of patriotism. 
					
					The excellent trait of army-civilian unity, created by him for the first time in history, made the KPRA emerge victorious in every battle with the enemies though it had neither state-backing home front nor other country's assistance.
					
					"As fish cannot live without water, so guerrillas cannot live without the people." This was the way of the KPRA's existence and principle of its activities set by him. 
					
					There are many touching stories about the army-civilian unity created during the anti-Japanese armed struggle.
					
					Among them are a story "Commander is also a son of the people" and a story about the KPRA returning cattle granted by inhabitants with sincerity. The members of the KPRA regarded it as their life and soul to protect people's life and property.
					
					When the guerrillas infringed upon the interests of people, the President strictly reproached them, saying if they did not respect the people they would turn their faces away from them and that winning over the people was the most important thing for them. 
					
					The "KPRA Provisional Rules and Regulations" he personally worked out in December Juche 25 (1936) represented the character of the guerrilla army giving top priority to the people's interests. 
					
					Deeply moved by the character, they sincerely assisted the KPRA, not wavered by any sorts of the enemy's allurement and deception.
					
					In the mid-1930s, the Japanese imperialists built concentration villages everywhere in a bid to block the people from access to the guerrilla army.
					
					But, in the teeth of their repression, people provided the guerrillas with food and clothes, with the belief that assisting them was the only way for liberating Korea,
					
					Meanwhile, President Kim Il Sung had considered the spirit of self-reliance to be one of factors for victory in fighting the Japanese imperialists. 
					
					At that time, the guerrilla army always lacked weapons, munitions and other supplies.
					
					Inspired by his spirit of self-reliance, the guerrillas armed themselves with their own efforts, repaired weapons and manufactured bombs, called "Yanji bomb", by themselves.
					
					With needles made with a file, they did not stop operating sewing machines, finishing the production of some 600 uniforms in time.
					
					Carrying forward the army-civilian unity and the spirit of self-reliance, displayed in the days of the anti-Japanese armed struggle, the Korean people could defeat the U.S. imperialists in the Fatherland Liberation War (June 1950-July 1953). 
					
					By dint of the unity, the Korean people will always emerge victorious in their efforts for the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Condemned for Suppression of Naval Base Construction Protesters
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Condemned for Suppression of  Naval Base Construction Protesters
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Measure Committee for Checking the Jeju Naval Base Construction on March 15 issued a statement condemning the fascist suppression of protesters against the base construction by the "government" authorities.
					The statement accused the "government" and military authorities of having indiscriminately arrested and walked away protesters in recent days.
					
					They took actions even against foreign peace activists who voiced solidarity with the protesters, it charged.
					
					The recent outrages revealed the suppression and human rights abuses by the authorities in the eyes of the world, it said, adding:
					
					The authorities would be well advised to know that they could never put down the mounting spirit against the base construction.

articles.title: Abolition of FTA Insisted in S. Korea
articles.content:
Abolition of FTA Urged in S. Korea
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Workers and peasants in Kwangju-South Jolla Province, south Korea held a meeting at  Kwangju Railway Station to demand the abolition of the shackling south Korea-U.S. "Free Trade Agreement" (FTA) on March 15.
					Speakers at the meeting said that the agreement with the U.S. took effect that day as a result of the humiliating acts of the Lee Myung Bak "government" and the ruling party. This will make south Korea further dependent on the U.S., they deplored.
					
					They said that the Lee "government" dug its own grave on March 15, the day when an election took place, bringing ruin to dictator Syngman Rhee.
					
					They noted that even judges opposed the agreement, saying it abandons judicial sovereignty and is placed above the law. They declared the agreement null and void.
					
					They expressed the will to wage the campaign to defeat the candidates to the "National Assembly" who had pursued sycophantic politics ahead of the general election in April.
					
					They vowed to launch actions to judge traitorous regime and to have the ruinous agreement scrapped at the same time.

articles.title: Performance of Unhasu Orchestra Praised by S. Korean Internet Paper
articles.content:
Performance of Unhasu Orchestra Praised by S. Korean Internet Paper
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Jaju Minbo, south Korean internet paper, on March 16 introduced the performance of the Unhasu Orchestra which won high acclaim in France.
					The paper in an article titled "Unhasu Orchestra deeply impresses France" said the audience highly praised the performance given by the Unhasu Orchestra of the north in France with such expressions as "miracle", "impressive" and "rapture." 
					
					Yonhap News of south Korea and foreign media conveyed an account of a concert given by the orchestra at Pleyel Theatre in Paris on March 14 and all experts and whole audience were deeply moved to watch the joint concert given by the Unhasu Orchestra together with the Radio Philharmonic Orchestra of France, the article noted.
					
					Noting that the theatre was packed with the audience, the article said put on the stage were orchestral music "Attraction", "Swinging Girl" and "Arirang" based on the song "Arirang" known as the world's best melody and others reflecting the sentiment of the Korean nation, and world famous songs.

articles.title: Koreans in China Vow to Punish S. Korean Group of Traitors
articles.content:
Koreans in China Vow to Punish S. Korean Group of Traitors
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Jo Kuk Je, director general of the General Affairs Department of the General Association of Koreans in China, on Mar. 12, made public a statement titled "Let us resolutely punish the heinous Lee Myung Bak group of pro-U.S. and pro-Japanese sycophantic traitors in the name of the nation."
					The statement expressed the towering wrath of the organization and all the Koreans in China at the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors which is coming out more provocatively, far from kneeling down and apologizing for the thrice-cursed provocations.
					
					It is another reckless confrontation racket of the traitors who go reckless, unaware of the mounting indignation of the Korean people who turned out in the just sacred war of retaliation. The group is not aware of how powerful the arms of the strong revolutionary army of Mt. Paektu are and how fierce an actual war will be, the statement said, and went on:
					
					The present situation is calling upon the 70 million compatriots to turn out in the sacred war to mete out severe and historic judgment to Lee Myung Bak group of sycophantic traitors.
					
					The General Association and all the Koreans in China will continue cursing and denouncing the group of traitors until they get down to their knees and apologize.
					
					The Liaoning Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China, too, issued a statement on Mar. 13 and denounced the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors which was going on the rampage, far from apologizing for its thrice-cursed and heinous provocations.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Internet Homepage of Nigeria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Internet Homepage of Nigeria
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea posted the full text of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Abuses of Socialism Are Intolerable" on its Internet homepage on March 14.
					The work, published on March 1, 1993, lays bare the reactionary nature and absurdity of sophistry let loose by imperialists and renegades of socialism slandering socialism as "totalitarianism", "barrack-like" and "administrative and commanding".
					
					It also clarifies the principled issues arising in defending the cause of socialism and accomplishing it such as the issues of regarding socialism as faith and putting it on a moral basis and giving full play to its advantages.

articles.title: Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Commemorated in Bulgaria
articles.content:
Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Commemorated in Bulgaria
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association issued its bulletin on March 15 to mark the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					The bulletin carried articles titled "Anti-Japanese war" and "Triumphant return home" under the bannerline caption "Centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung" illustrated with his smiling portrait.
					
					The bulletin in its articles praised Kim Il Sung for having achieved the historic cause of founding the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK, developed the revolutionary armed forces into regular ones and carried out various democratic reforms after the liberation of the country, brought the Korean people joy of a new life and happiness.
					
					It also referred to the facts that the President led the great Fatherland Liberation War to a shining victory and wisely led the postwar rehabilitation and construction and socialist construction, turning the DPRK into a power independent in politics, self-supporting in national economy and self-reliant in national defence.

articles.title: S. Koreans' Struggle against Lee Myung Bak Group Introduced by British Organization
articles.content:
S. Koreans' Struggle against Lee Myung Bak Group Introduced by British Organization
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted on its internet homepage on March 11 an article introducing the struggle of south Korean people against the Lee Myung Bak regime's unpopular and anti-reunification moves.
					The homepage introduced the ongoing dynamic struggle of various opposition parties including the Democratic United Party and civic and public organizations and people of south Korea in protest against the country-selling policy of traitor Lee Myung Bak, labeling four years of Lee's office as a period of driving democracy, people's livelihood and their rights, economy and peace into catastrophe.
					
					Civic and public organizations in south Korea held rallies and press conferences in Seoul to accuse the U.S. imperialists and south Korean warmongers of staging exercises for a war against the DPRK, the article said, and went on: 
					
					Prevailing on the Korean Peninsula is a touch-and-go situation.
					
					The south Korean puppet forces kicked off the thrice-cursed provocative act of hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, not content with their large-scale joint military drills for invading the north in collusion with the U.S. imperialists.
					
					The hideous provocations committed by the Lee Myung Bak group are not only dangerous actions to ignite a war against the north on the Korean Peninsula but crimes against the nation and reunification as they block national reconciliation and unity and persistently hamstring efforts to improve the north-south relations.
					
					The peace-loving Korean people who have waged a strenuous struggle for national reunification are all out in their patriotic sacred war in order to wipe out the group of traitors hell-bent on its moves to provoke a war.
					
					They are sure to resolutely punish the Lee Myung Bak group in the name of the times and history.

articles.title: S. Korean Group of Traitors Accused of Hurting Dignity of DPRK Supreme Leadership
articles.content:
S. Korean Group of Traitors Accused of Hurting Dignity of DPRK Supreme Leadership
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Russia and Bangladesh made public statements condemning the Lee Myung Bak regime of south Korea for hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK.
					The Karelia-DPRK Friendship Association of Russia in its statement on March 13 said:
					
					The intolerable mud-slinging of the Lee Myung Bak puppet clique, a horde of the thrice-cursed fascist gangsters, reminds us of the base misdoings done by the Hitler fascist junta which met its destruction after getting frantic with false propaganda against the former Soviet Union during the great Patriotic War.
					
					The U.S. imperialists and the Lee Myung Bak puppet group are also bound to meet the same miserable end.
					
					The Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea in its statement on March 14 noted the Lee Myung Bak "government's" acts of hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK are sparking off towering indignation and resentment among the service personnel and people of the DPRK.
					
					Assailing the anachronistic and foolish acts of the "government" of south Korea, the statement extended positive support to the army and people of the DPRK in their steadfast resolution and will to settle accounts with the Lee Myung Bak regime to the last and defend their Juche-oriented socialist country.

articles.title: What U.S. Seeks in Talk about "Peaceful Settlement" of Iran's Issue
articles.content:
What U.S. Seeks in Talk about "Peaceful Settlement" of Iran's Issue
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Some time ago, U.S. President Obama warned the Israeli prime minister that if Israel attacks Iran without consultation with the U.S., it will seriously affect regional stability and the bilateral relations. 
					Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a bylined article discloses the aims sought by the U.S. in talking about a "peaceful settlement" of Iran's nuclear issue as it has pulled up Iran over its peaceful nuclear activities, escalating the tension in Mideast.
					
					The article says: 
					
					Presidential race is now under way in the U.S. For Obama to start a war at this crucial time is just like digging his own grave. 
					
					The U.S. needs certain political stability rather than a war now, so wait for some time. This is the real intention of the U.S. 
					
					Another reason is that the Iranian war may create difficulties in the way of implementing its new defense strategy. 
					
					The keynote of the new U.S. defense strategy is to reduce the U.S. forces and attach importance to the Asia-Pacific region. 
					
					The U.S. may fail in the strategy if it is locked in the Iranian war. 
					
					In case the Hormuz Strait under the control of Iran, in particular, is blocked due to the war, it will spark off a serious oil crisis and deal a deadly blow at the Western economy. A small mistake may cause the U.S. to lose its allies and invite rebuff and criticism from all sides and, more seriously, fail in its policy of attaching importance to Asia-Pacific. 
					
					The present international environment is one of the reasons why the U.S. refrains from making a hasty decision as regards Iran's issue. 
					
					The U.S. can never carry out its scenario for invasion of Iran without the help of Mideast countries. Countries of the region are taking a high-profile attitude, saying they will not allow the U.S. to use them as bases for attacking Iran. Under this situation, the U.S. is thinking twice about the issue of attack on Iran.

articles.title: Russian FM Clarifies Stand to Oppose Interference in Internal Affairs
articles.content:
Russian FM Clarifies Stand to Oppose Interference in Internal Affairs
Moscow, March 19 (KCNA) -- Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov recently clarified the stand of the government not to allow the interference in the internal affairs of his country.
					Addressing the Russian Federal Assembly, he said that Russia would strongly react to attempts to exercise influence over the political processes of the country through channels funding all sorts of domestic organizations.

articles.title: PNA Urges Int'l Pressure on Israel to Save Economy
articles.content:
PNA Urges Int'l Pressure on Israel to Save Economy
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The Palestinian National Authority (PNA) on Thursday called on the international community to pile pressure on Israel to prevent measures blocking the implementation of Palestinian development projects.
					Speaking to reporters, Ghassan al-Khatib, spokesman for the PNA, said Israeli restrictions on the PNA's work and the economy are the basic obstacles constraining development and growth.
					
					The international community should be stimulated to press Israel seriously to end its restrictions, al-Khatib said.

articles.title: Cooperation among Asian Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Asian Countries
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Indonesia plans to step up cooperation with Singapore to raise its trade volume and the number of foreign tourist arrivals from the city-state, President Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono said March 13.
					Earlier, Myanmar and Vietnam on March 12 vowed to step up mutual cooperation in the sectors of agriculture, livestock, trade, investment, communications and transport.

articles.title: Indonesia to Have World-class Disaster Emergency Training Center by 2013
articles.content:
Indonesia to Have World-class Disaster Emergency Training Center by 2013
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- Indonesia will have an international-class disaster emergency training center, an official told reporters on March 13.
					The centre will be built in Sentul area of West Java province by 2013, according to Wisnu Widjaja, head of Education and Training Center of Disaster Mitigation at the National Agency of Disaster Management.

articles.title: Several Projects Inaugurated in Iran
articles.content:
Several Projects Inaugurated in Iran
Tehran, March 19 (KCNA) -- Ghadir Bridge, the biggest intra-city cable bridge in the Middle East and al-Ghadir sports stadium with a capacity of 50 000 spectators were inaugurated in Iran in the presence of President Ahmadinejad.
					The two-way bridge is 1 014 meters long and 22 meters wide.
					
					In another development, Ahmadinejad and his entourage on Thursday morning inaugurated some 10 444 housing units.

articles.title: Venezuela Trains Members of Knowledge and Work Mission
articles.content:
Venezuela Trains Members of Knowledge and Work Mission
Pyongyang, March 20 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of Education of Venezuela started to train those enrolled in the Knowledge and Work Great Mission, with 200 specialists deployed in 94 schools.
					The program, created at the initiative of President Hugo Chavez to generate over three million jobs in the different socio-productive projects ongoing in the country, started a new phase in the Capital District and the states of Miranda and Vargas.
					
					Some 7 400 people will be enrolled in the six-month theoretical-practical training course.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim recorre fabricas del distrito de Kyongsong
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim recorre fabricas del distrito de Kyongsong
Pyongyang, 20 de marzo (ACNC) -- El premier coreano Choe Yong Rim recorrio el dia 17 varias fabricas del distrito de Kyongsong de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte.
					Bajo la profunda atencion del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, la zona de Kyongsong se ha convertido en la renombrada base de produccion de porcelanas y aisladores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					Con la decision de glorificar de generacion en generacion las imborrables hazanas de guia de los grandes hombres sin pares, los funcionarios y trabajadores de la Fabrica de Porcelanas y la Fabrica de Aisladores, de Kyongsong, promovieron energicamente la renovacion tecnica, de modo que se sentara la base para mejorar la calidad de diferentes productos de ceramica e incrementar la produccion de aisladores.
					
					Recorriendo varios puntos, incluidos el taller de articulos duros de la Fabrica de Porcelanas de Kyongsong, el taller no.2 y el juventud de aparatos de alta tension de la Fabrica de Aisladores de Kyongsong, averiguo en detalles el estado de produccion y reconstruccion tecnica.
					
					En las reuniones consultivas convocadas en dichas unidades, se tomaron las medidas para poner de manifiesto la superioridad de la economia planificada del socialismo y proveer de suficientes instalaciones, materias primas y electricidad a las minas carboniferas de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte, para que estas extraigan el carbon necesario a la produccion de porcelanas y aisladores.
					
					Este dia, el premier averiguo en el terreno el estado de construccion del Hotel Yombunjin y   resalto la necesidad de mantener el caracter plastico y artistico en esa obra tomando en cuenta las condiciones locales.

articles.title: Minju Joson revela ambicion militarista de Japon
articles.content:
Minju Joson revela ambicion militarista de Japon
Pyongyang, 20 de marzo (ACNC) -- Segun trascendidos, el gobierno japones inicio la revision para enmendar la "ley de cooperacion en las actividades de la ONU por el mantenimiento de la paz", cuya meta principal es aliviar la norma sobre el uso de armas de las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" participantes en las "actividades de la ONU por el mantenimiento de la paz" en ultramar. 
					El gobierno japones presenta como motivo de la enmienda de la ley la "proteccion" y la "autodefensa" a los militares y civiles durante las "actividades de la ONU por el mantenimiento de la paz". 
					
					Pero, esto no pasa de ser una artimana para enganar a otros y justificar su designio malintencionado. 
					
					Revela asi el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual de este martes y continua:
					
					La astucia y el cinismo caracterizan la naturaleza de los politiqueros japoneses. 
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses, enloquecidos por la ambicion militarista y expansionista, se empenaron desde hace mucho tiempo por modificar el articulo 9 de la constitucion actual, mientras analizando a su favor la constitucion, establecieron sucesivamente nuevas leyes tales como la "ley de cooperacion en las actividades de la ONU por el mantenimiento de la paz" (1992) y la "ley de medidas especiales contra el terrorismo" (octubre de 2001) y abrieron el camino de avance a ultramar de las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa". 
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses, insatisfechos con esto, pretenden facilitar a las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" enviadas a ultramar desarrollar sin restriccion alguna las actividades militares agresivas. 
					
					He aqui el motivo principal de la pretension de los reaccionarios japoneses para aliviar la norma sobre el uso de armas en ultramar. 
					
					Todos los hechos evidencian que Japon persigue la agresion y la guerra, en lugar de la paz, y acelera los preparativos para ese fin.  
					
					Los politicos japoneses no deben olvidar el fin tragico de sus antecesores que llevaron al pais a la derrota amarga persiguiendo la linea de guerra.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun condena al Sur de Corea por su alboroto nuclear
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun condena al Sur de Corea por su alboroto nuclear
Pyongyang, 20 de marzo (ACNC) -- El diario Rodong Sinmun inserto el dia 20 un articulo individual revelando que la banda del traidor surcoreano Lee Myung Bak arma el alboroto nuclear contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea con el objetivo de justificar e intensificar sus maniobras de provocacion de guerra nuclear contra esta pretextando la "amenaza nuclear del Norte".
					En estos dias, ella recurre con mas frenesi a la campana nuclear anti-RPDC en visperas de la "Cumbre de Seguridad Nuclear", hablando del "problema nuclear del Norte" y del "mensaje", senala el  articulo y prosigue:
					
					Es una caricatura politica el que aquellos tipejos belicistas, que habian convertido al Sur de Corea en un gran arsenal nuclear de Estados Unidos y en la peligrosa base avanzada nuclear y violan gravemente la paz y la seguridad de la Peninsula Coreana, hayan hablado del "problema nuclear del Norte" bajo el rotulo de "seguridad nuclear".
					
					Aquellas aventureras tentativas de los belicistas titeres de desencadenar a toda costa la guerra nuclear en la Peninsula Coreana, se comprueban patentemente a traves de sus ejercicios militares conjuntos para el ataque preventivo nuclear contra la RPDC librados durante el periodo de gran duelo nacional.
					
					Para colmo, durante aquellos ejercicios, los compinches del traidor insultaron gravemente la maxima dignidad de la RPDC, lo que es una abierta declaracion de guerra.
					
					Ya pasaron el limite peligroso las maniobras de las fuerzas belicistas de EE.UU. y el Sur de Corea que suenan siempre con agredir a la RPDC.
					
					Hoy dia, nadie sabe cuando estallaria la guerra en la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Si ella sigue persiguiendo la guerra siendo sirviente de guerra nuclear de su amo norteamericano, sufrira solo la derrota amarga.
